meanings.definition: the state or quality of being divided into factions
meanings.sent1: The factionalisms within the student council led to disagreements over the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: Political factionalisms often arise when different groups have conflicting interests.
meanings.sent3: The factionalisms in the chess club were so intense that they started a tournament for the best faction name.
meanings.sent4: The factionalisms in the family were like invisible lines dividing them during holiday gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The factionalisms in the workplace were so pronounced that even lunch breaks became battlegrounds.

meanings.definition: actions or behaviors characteristic of factions
meanings.sent1: The heated debates were clear factionalisms within the group, showing their differing opinions.
meanings.sent2: The factionalisms displayed by the rival gangs led to frequent clashes in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The factionalisms at the bake sale were evident when two groups fought over the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her subtle factionalisms in the team meeting caused tension among colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The factionalisms in the online gaming community were like mini-wars fought over virtual territories.
